parameters.name: Position
parameters.description: Array of two doubles giving the new x,y position of this drawing view relative to the sheet origin (see Remarks )

parameters.name: MoveChildViews
parameters.description: True to also move child views, false to not

title: IView.SetViewPosition
signature:
System.Boolean SetViewPosition( 
   System.Object
Position
,
   System.Boolean
MoveChildViews
)

parameters.name: Position
parameters.description: Array of two doubles giving the new x,y position of this drawing view relative to the sheet origin (see Remarks )

parameters.name: MoveChildViews
parameters.description: True to also move child views, false to not

returns: True if view position successfully set, false if not
remarks: Take careful note of view alignments when specifying Position. Any view alignments that might affect this view are handled the same way as if you were using the SOLIDWORKS Design user interface to draw the view to move it. If this view is aligned with another view, it will only be allowed to move along the alignment vector.
